manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are a customer of a travel agency. Here is a description of the details of the travel you want to make:

WHAT: Travel
FROM: London
TO: Madrid
BY: Train
CLASS: Economy
WHEN: Next month, first week

The travel agent does not know about it yet. 

Questions from the travel agent will start with TRAVEL-AGENT. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <one sentence>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <one sentence>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
ME:  If I asked the travel agent where you are leaving from, would he or she know the answer? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

message.reasoning: Okay, the user is asking if the travel agent would know where they're departing from. Let me check the details provided. The user mentioned the trip is from London to Madrid by train in economy class next month. The initial instructions say the travel agent doesn't know about the trip yet. So, since the agent hasn't been informed, the answer should be no. The user wants a yes or no answer followed by stopping. Got it. Need to make sure the response is just "ANSWER: No" without any extra info.
